whapi 0.0.2

Convert R objects into pretty JSON (character)

Source: R/webhook.R
whapi_to_pretty_json.Rd

Wrapper around jsonlite::toJSON() to serialize lists/data.frames into human-readable JSON for logging or persistence. Returns NA_character_ if jsonlite is not installed or conversion fails.

Usage

whapi_to_pretty_json(x)

Arguments

x

Any R object (list, vector, data.frame).

Value

Character scalar containing pretty-printed JSON, or NA_character_.

Examples

whapi_to_pretty_json(list(a=1, b=2))
#> [1] "{\n  \"a\": 1,\n  \"b\": 2\n}"
whapi_to_pretty_json(mtcars[1:2,1:2])
#> [1] "[\n  {\n    \"mpg\": 21,\n    \"cyl\": 6,\n    \"_row\": \"Mazda RX4\"\n  },\n  {\n    \"mpg\": 21,\n    \"cyl\": 6,\n    \"_row\": \"Mazda RX4 Wag\"\n  }\n]"

On this page

whapi is part of an ecosystem of R packages for data analysis and computational document processing
developed at the Secretaria Executiva de Monitoramento Estratégico.

Developed by André Leite, Diogo Bezerra and Hugo Medeiros
